page.title: 17Robinswood Hill.
page.content: On the southern edge of Gloucester is Robinswood Hill, a Country Park. It is looked after by a resident warden. Amenities include: Information Centre, picnic sites, 18 hole and 9 hole golf courses, a long dry ski slope, nature trails, pony trails and way-marked walks for all ages. The steep grass slopes provide good toboggan runs in winter. Special areas of scientific interest are allocated for the use of Gloucester schools and are closed to the general public. The 198m summit has a toposcope supplied by the A.A. indicating various points of interest in the panoramic views e.g. the Severn Bridge, the Malvern Hills and the Cotswold Hills.
